He is also a former member of the Pontifical Historical Commission.<ref>[http://www.divinity.cam.ac.uk/index.php?option=com_mipeople&view=person&id=18&departmentid=2&Itemid=60 Eamon Duffy profile]</ref> His work has done much to overturn the popular image of late-medieval Catholicism in England as moribund, and instead presents it as a vibrant cultural force. On weekdays from 22 October to 2 November 2007, he presented the BBC Radio 4 series ''10 Popes Who Shook the World''<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio4/tenpopeswhoshooktheworld/ Ten Popes Who Shook the World], ''BBC Radio 4''</ref> - those popes featured were [[Saint Peter|Peter]], [[Pope Leo I|Leo I]], [[Gregory the Great|Gregory I]], [[Pope Gregory VII|Gregory VII]], [[Pope Innocent III|Innocent III]], [[Pope Paul III|Paul III]], [[Pope Pius IX|Pius IX]], [[Pope Pius XII|Pius XII]], [[Pope John XXIII|John XXIII]], and [[Pope John Paul II|John Paul II]]. == Prizes and awards == * [[Hawthornden Prize]] for literature in 2002: ''The Voices of Morebath: Reformation and Rebellion in an English Village'' * Honorary fellowship from St Mary's College in 2003 (he later resigned from the position in protest at management decisions at the college made by its principal, [[Philip Esler]])<ref>http://www.catholicherald.co.uk/news/2012/09/25/top-historian-criticises-st-marys-for-grotesque-treatment-of-professor/</ref> ==Books== * ''Humanism, Reform and the Reformation: The Career of Bishop John Fisher'' (1989), with Brendan Bradshaw *''[[The Stripping of the Altars]]: Traditional Religion in England, c.1400 to c.1580'' (1992) * {{cite book|title=Saints and Sinners, a History of the Popes|year=1997|publisher=Yale University Press|isbn=0-300-07332-1}} * ''The Voices of Morebath: Reformation and Rebellion in an English Village'' (2001) * ''Faith of Our Fathers: Reflections on Catholic Tradition'' (2004) * ''Walking to Emmaus'' (2006) * ''Marking the Hours: English People and Their Prayers, 1240-1570'' (2007) * ''Fires of Faith: Catholic England under Mary Tudor'' (2009) * ''Ten Popes Who Shook the World'' (2011) ASIN B00680FXEY * ''Saints, Sacrilege and Sedition: Religion and Conflict in the Tudor Reformations'' (2012) ISBN 1441181172 ==See also==
